column5: Snuck out for a bit this aft once the sun came up for some carp.  Tried a local creek but the flow was washing a lot of junk downstream with the rain and fouling my line. Picked up and moved to my regular spot.  Within 20 mins I noticed my line go totally slack (for once I was paying attention and not just listening for my baitclicker). I reeled in until I felt some weight and then the fish took off.  At first I thought it was a little guy and then he turned into a rock and I could barely gain any line. I made sure not to horse it and finally got it in the net after three tries (hence I need a bigger net). It was my longest carp to date but not as fat as my previous pb from a couple weeks ago.  Hard to tell which one weighed more. 37" x 24.5" I once again regret not having a scale but was holding off on the purchase until I get the inevitable bass pro gift cards for my birthday. Figured it wasn't going to get any better than that, so decided to pack it in on a high note.  Was fishing an inline bolt rig with a piece of tutti fruity monster maize.  I figured the upsized bait (from regular corn) would be more visible in the murky post-rain water.
That's a big fish...way to go
Nice big Carp! I've got some roses in the back yard that are just screaming for that bad boy to be laid to rest underneath. HH
Congrats on the longest ever SBK
